hobby.message: Urban exploration or just drinking underground?
You flying analog or digital FPV drones these days?

wrong_hobby_answer: That's not me. In free time, I explore the city's underground. It's a different world down there.
neutral_answer: Quiet enough, for now.
Been out poking around some forgotten places—urban spelunking is my thing.
Not as easy lately; too many patrols on those routes now.
City’s just not as open as it used to be.
Guess so.
I mostly keep to quiet spots underground—old conduits and closed-down utility tunnels.
Urban exploration is my main hobby, when the system lets me.
These last couple weeks, patrols stepped up near every access hatch.
Not the relaxing kind of walk it used to be.
Bit quieter than usual.
I pass the time exploring decommissioned data centers and old tunnels, urban exploration style.
It’s a hobby, keeps me away from screens.
Patrols have been cracking down since all the BCI mess started.
Had to turn back the other night—couldn’t even get in.
City’s clamping down hard in places people forget exist.
Definitely quieter. Used to be you’d notice the shift by where you could wander.
I do a lot of urban exploring—tunnels, backup power vaults, anywhere left off those official maps.
Home-brewed liquor and a quiet circuit to myself is the routine.
But ever since those wild BCI swings, can’t even count on entry codes working.
Saw new Directorate sensors on my usual route—never used to see that kind of coverage.
Navigating those spots takes more luck than skill now.
It’s making the city feel smaller, honestly.
Quieter on the surface, sure, but down below it’s crawling with new security.
I spend my free time exploring the city’s underbelly—old fiber routes, data bunkers, sealed service crawlways.
Been at it since I left state maintenance. Know almost every useful tunnel in the grid.
Usually, I’d slip through after hours with a flask, check if any old equipment’s humming.
These past weeks, patrols doubled, Directorate scanners at every hatch. Nearly got flagged just for walking a route I’ve used for years.
Lost half my usual circuits—sometimes the hatch codes just lock for no reason after a score reroll.
Hard to explain the disappointment: the city’s closing in from every angle.
It’s less about exploring now, more about staying one step ahead of whichever algorithm thinks you’re a problem.
hobby_answer: No ghosts tonight. Just damp pipes and extra locks.
Harder to get in now with the new patrols.
Not worth it if you land on a list somewhere.
Used to be quieter, that’s all.
Didn’t see any ghosts, unless you count extra patrols.
Whole network’s tighter since last week’s riots.
Some hatches sealed, codes changed overnight.
I keep my head down, move fast.
Best not to linger too long these days.
Not a ghost in sight, just more cameras and locked panels.
They doubled security kick-outs after those score spikes in West Bloc.
Makes wandering nerve-wracking. Even old haunts feel risky.
Caught some guards eyeing me—acting like every hobbyist’s a threat.
Guess the city’s more on edge than usual lately.
No ghosts this time, but I dodged two patrols underground.
Ever since they started yanking BCI scores left and right, every route’s a maze.
Got stopped at a vent, had to play dumb technician—brings back old job memories.
Used to take my drink and relax down there. Now it feels like someone's always watching.
Flask didn’t come out till I was topside. City’s closing itself up lately.
No ghosts—just echoes and that paranoia whistle you get in sealed corridors.
Been poking those tunnels since before Halden brought in all this mess.
These days, privilege shifts mean half my favorite access points are sealed off.
Patrols have lists now, and my face isn’t unknown. Harder to slip by without risking a flag.
Riots got everyone jumpy. Saw a young kid bolt when a drone buzzed overhead.
I miss when the place hummed with old server static, not sensor pings.
Used to trade stories with the night crews, now no one shares routes.
Feels like I’m exploring a city that doesn’t want to be found. Or remembered.
